alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Stark; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 12:11AM EDT until June 14 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Stark County in northeastern Ohio... Southern Wayne County in northeastern Ohio... Northeastern Holmes County in northeastern Ohio... * Until 1245 AM EDT. * At 1210 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Mount Eaton, or 10 miles northeast of Millersburg, moving east at 45 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR southern Wayne, northern Holmes, and western Stark Counties. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * Locations impacted include... Wooster, Millersburg, Massillon, Berlin, Walnut Creek, Brewster, Navarre, Shreve, Waynesburg, East Sparta, Holmesville, Wilmot, Mount Eaton, Winesburg, Apple Creek, Beach City, Bolivar, Fredericksburg and Mount Hope. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
